args: One day, Luca and Sarisse were practicing\ntheir archery in the castle courtyard.
Well done, both of you. Most impressive.
Even back in my village, there weren't\nmany with skills like yours.
Well, our target IS standin' still.
Yeah, we usually aim at moving stuff.
A fair point—nothing improves your skills\nfaster than experience in the field.
...Heh. That brings back memories of a\nchildhood spent hunting in the mountains.
You can't beat a sylvan when\nit comes to hunting.
We humans are also pretty skilled\nwhen it comes to hunting, you know.
But you're a mercenary, Irfan.\nNot a hunter.
For reasons I won't get into here,\nI also spent my childhood on the hunt.
Ah, there you two are. \nOh, I see you have company.
All the better, in point of fact.\nMight I ask all of you a favor?
Our stockpile of meat has run dry,\nso I was hoping I could ask you to—
I'll bring you the catch of the century!
Now THIS sounds like a contest!\nWhat say we compete to see who\ncan bring home the best catch?
Wait, no! This isn't what I—
I'm not gonna be beaten either.\nLet's do this thing!
A hunting battle? That takes me back.\nYou're all on!
Not the pair of you, too!
Tsk. I wish they would have\nat least let me finish...
Perhaps I can be of assistance.
I'm glad to see you are all\nunharmed and... Um...
Guys, knock it off! Cleo's gonna think\nshe keeled over or something.
Sarisse, maybe YOU can tell me\nwhat's going on here.
See, Eleonora, she... Umm...\nWell, she went nuts.
She heard rumors about a giant beast\ndeep in the forest and went chargin'\nafter it like a crazy person.
I think it's best if we all forget\nabout her and move on.
Yeah, it's all very sad or whatever.\nBut now let's look at what I caught!
No, me! Look at mine first, Cleo!
You've both caught a fine deer.
Yeah, but mine's bigger, so I win.
No way! Mine looks way firmer and tastier!\nYours is all sick and, like, blaaaaaargh.
I just can't believe how proud you both\nseem of your pathetic catches.
You really don't know the first thing\nabout hunting, do you?
Your catch better be REALLY first-rate\nto be flappin' your gums like that, pal!
Oh, it is. Get a load of THIS!
That's because you don't know what you're\nlooking for. This sleek coat will fetch a\nking's ransom on the open market!
You can eat it OR you can sell it.\nThis is what hunting is REALLY about!
No surprise you wouldn't think that way,\nsince you're clearly not into economics.
We know all ABOUT ergonomics!\nDon't we, Luca?
Oh, sure. That's what bats use to\nsee where they're going.
Pffft. I'll take my victory trophy now.
Well, I hate to spoil all of this...fun,\nbut what I actually asked for is—
Oh, Hawk! How nice to see you.
I procured the meat you asked for.\nPlease ensure it is of a high quality.
Hey! You just went into town\nand BOUGHT this!
Is that bow of yours for show, Hawk?\nI thought you were a hunter like us!
Are your ears for show? Did you not think\nto let Cleo finish making her request?
Understanding what your client wants\nis the most basic part of a successful job.
All I wanted you to do is buy meat in the\nvillage, but you went hunting instead.
Well, that's just shameful. Can't believe\nI jumped to conclusions like that.
Still, you've gathered some fine meat\nand proved your skill as hunters.
I agree. Tonight is going to be\nquite the banquet indeed.
Now THAT'S what I'm talkin' about.\nTonight we feast!
I guess we're all winners this time.
Hmm. I feel like we're forgetting\nsomething here...
These footprints are huge—they must\nbelong to the master of the forest!
...Hmm. Come to think of it,\nwhat am I hunting him for, anyway?
...Well, who cares about the details\nwhen I'm having such a good time?
Watch out, beast! Here I come!
